vasista_story.role: Vedic Sage, one of the Sapta Rishis, Royal Guru of the Solar Dynasty

lineage.house: Solar Dynasty (Ikshvaku lineage as royal priest)

coreidentity: Author of Vasishta Samhita and Yoga Vasishta

scripturalconnections.rigveda: Composer of several hymns; associated with cosmic order and truth
scripturalconnections.ramayana: Royal guru to King Dasharatha; advisor to Rama
scripturalconnections.yogavasishta: Philosophical dialogue with Rama on liberation and reality

philosophicalthemes: Power of Sattva (purity) over Rajas and Tamas

majorstories.description: Defended Dharma against Vishwamitra’s ambitions; later reconciled
Taught Rama the essence of Vedanta through Yoga Vasishta
Owned the divine cow Kamadhenu, symbol of abundance and spiritual power

iconography: Holding a rosary and water pot (Kamandalu)

mantras.name: Vasishta Invocation
mantras.meaning: Salutation to Sage Vasishta, embodiment of wisdom

timeline.event: Born from Brahma’s mind; recognized as one of the Sapta Rishis
Served as chief priest and advisor to Ikshvaku kings including Dasharatha
Defended Dharma; later transformed rivalry into friendship
Imparted Yoga Vasishta philosophy to Rama during his existential crisis
Continued as a guiding light of Vedantic wisdom; revered in all ages

keyverses.verse: चित्तमेव हि संसारः तस्मात् तन्म् निरोधयेत्।
keyverses.transliteration: Chittam eva hi samsarah tasmat tan nirodhayet
keyverses.meaning: Mind alone is the cause of bondage; therefore, control the mind.

keyverses.verse: यदा चित्तं प्रसन्नं स्यात् तदा सर्वं प्रसन्नम्।
keyverses.transliteration: Yada chittam prasannam syat tada sarvam prasannam
keyverses.meaning: When the mind is serene, everything appears serene.
I am unattached, I am unattached—again and again realize this truth.
